Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Succumb \Suc*cumb"\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Succumbed}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Succumbing}.] [L. succumbere; sub under + cumbere (in comp.), akin to cubare to lie down. See {Incumbent}, {Cubit}.] To yield; to submit; to give up unresistingly; as, to succumb under calamities; to succumb to disease. [1913 Webster]
succumb v 1: consent reluctantly [syn: {yield}, {give in}, {knuckle under}, {buckle under}] 2: be fatally overwhelmed [syn: {yield}] [ant: {survive}]
